macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Supreme Court Strikes Down Trump Tariffs, Prompting Global Trade Scrutiny
items.summary: The US Supreme Court ruled against some Trump administration global tariffs, leading governments worldwide to assess impacts; President Trump announced new 10% tariffs via executive order, later raising to 15%. Trade officials in South Korea, Europe, and elsewhere held emergency meetings amid market roil.

items.title: Warren Buffett Indicator Hits 220.1%, Signals S&P 500 Crash Risk in 2026
items.summary: The Warren Buffett indicator reached 220.1%, exceeding pre-2022 decline levels, prompting warnings from Capital Economics and Goldman Sachs of potential S&P 500 downturn amid high valuations, rising rates, and slowing earnings. Tech sell-offs have cooled markets but overvaluation persists.

items.title: Prediction Markets Forecast S&P 500 Correction in 2026 Ahead of Midterms
items.summary: Prediction market traders anticipate an S&P 500 correction this year, with historical patterns suggesting sharper drops before midterm elections. Recent tech sector declines highlight ongoing market pressures.

items.title: Tech Stocks Tumble as Analysts Diverge on S&P 500 Outlook for 2026
items.summary: Workday shares down 30% YTD and UK-listed RELX down 23% amid tech rebalancing; analysts mixed on S&P 500 with correction fears due to valuations, while FTSE 100 outlook remains optimistic on dividends. Opportunities eyed in cheaper UK tech valuations.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Trades at $68,014 Amid Extreme Retail Fear and Institutional Buying
items.summary: Bitcoin is consolidating at $68,014 with a Fear & Greed Index of 9 indicating retail panic, while spot Bitcoin ETFs saw $88M net inflows led by BlackRock and Fidelity on February 20. Influencers remain bullish with 2026 targets from $85K to $300K.

items.title: Trump Delivers Major Crypto Policy Announcement at Florida Forum
items.summary: Donald Trump announced a bold vision for cryptocurrency, blockchain, Web3, and DeFi in a live speech on February 21, potentially reshaping U.S. crypto regulation and policy ahead of 2026 elections. The event signals crypto's growing political importance.

items.title: Bitcoin Dips on Trump Tariff Hike to 15% Then Recovers
items.summary: Bitcoin briefly fell after President Trump's announcement of raising global tariffs from 10% to 15% following a Supreme Court ruling, but rebounded and remains up 0.7% amid broader market volatility. Traders eye impacts as markets reopen.

items.title: Bloomberg Analyst Predicts Bitcoin Crash to $10K in 2026
items.summary: A Bloomberg analyst forecasts Bitcoin potentially dropping to $10,000 in 2026, contrasting bullish market sentiments and raising debates on crash risks versus growth potential.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Generative AI Outperforms Human Teams in Analyzing Medical Data
items.summary: Researchers at UC San Francisco and Wayne State University found that generative AI can process complex medical datasets and generate prediction models faster than human expert teams, sometimes producing stronger results. In tests using preterm birth prediction data, AI chatbots created usable code in minutes from precise prompts.

items.title: Samsung Expands Galaxy AI with Multi-Agent Ecosystem
items.summary: Samsung announced the expansion of Galaxy AI to support multiple integrated AI agents across its Galaxy devices, enhancing user choice, flexibility, and seamless interactions. The update reflects growing user reliance on multiple AI agents for daily tasks.

items.title: ISO CASCO Addresses Governing AI in Conformity Assessment
items.summary: ISO CASCO discusses the need for standards and accreditation systems to adapt to AI as a disruptive force in conformity assessment processes.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Nvidia RTX 5090 Ti / Titan Blackwell GPU Specs Leak
items.summary: Leaks reveal Nvidia's flagship RTX 50 Blackwell GPU, tentatively RTX 5090 Ti or Titan, with 5% more CUDA cores than RTX 5090, 700-750W TDP, and potential 15-20% performance uplift. Possible Q3 2026 launch.

items.title: Supreme Court Strikes Down Trump Tariffs
items.summary: The US Supreme Court ruled against a portion of President Trump’s tariffs, potentially allowing businesses to reclaim billions in payments and boosting company profits and stock prices.

items.title: "Death of SaaS" as AI Disrupts Cybersecurity Market
items.summary: Anthropic’s Claude Code Security tool exposed vulnerabilities missed by traditional scanners, causing $15B market cap loss for firms like CrowdStrike and Cloudflare, signaling end of per-seat SaaS pricing.

items.title: Big Tech New Graduate Hires Drop to 7%
items.summary: Analysis of 650M LinkedIn profiles shows new graduates now only 7% of Big Tech hires, down from 25% in 2023, amid shifts away from coding skills.
